glsa.title: Cross-realm trust vulnerability in Heimdal
glsa.synopsis: Heimdal contains cross-realm vulnerability allowing someone with control over a realm to impersonate anyone in the cross-realm trust path.

background.p: Heimdal is a free implementation of Kerberos 5.

description.p: Heimdal does not properly perform certain consistency checks for cross-realm requests, which allows remote attackers with control of a realm to impersonate others in the cross-realm trust path.

impact.p: Remote attackers with control of a realm may be able to impersonate other users in the cross-realm trust path.

workaround.p: A workaround is not currently known for this issue. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest version of the affected package.

resolution.p: Heimdal users should upgrade to version 0.6.1 or later:
